alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Coastal Harris; Montgomery; Northern Liberty; Polk; Southern Liberty (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 6:33AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms moving east of the Houston metro early this morning... At 632 AM CDT, doppler radar and the public reported strong thunderstorms clustered around a line extending from 6 miles west of Caney Head to 6 miles northwest of Dayton. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Doppler radar and Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Baytown, Liberty, Cleveland, Dayton, Mont Belvieu, Splendora, Patton Village, Roman Forest, Old River-Winfree, Ames, Daisetta, Hardin, Plum Grove, Kenefick, Devers, North Cleveland, Dayton Lakes, Tarkington Prairie, Moss Hill and Romayor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
